DOC.brief_title: Oxidative Stress Cardiovascular Morbidity Sleep Apnea-Hypopnea Syndrome ( SAHS )
DOC.detailed_description: Aim : To compare level 8-isoprostane oxidative stress biomarkers plasma condense exhaled air patient SAHS cardiovascular complication , patient SAHS without cardiovascular complication control subject . To evaluate effect three month treatment CPAP oxidative stress biomarkers . Design : randomize , double blind , parallel group control placebo study . Study subject : 53 patient SAHS ( 23 cardiovascular complication 30 without cardiovascular complication ) , 23 patient cardiovascular disease without SAHS 23 control subject . Interventions : Three month treatment therapeutic CPAP sham CPAP ( placebo ) . Determinations : clinical ( cardiovascular morbidity ) anthropometric data . Fat free corporal mass , echocardiography , spirometry , ambulatory monitoring arterial pressure , endothelial reactivity . Oxidative stress biomarkers ( 8-isoprostane , homocysteine , HIF-1 , NFkB , AP-1 , VEGF , ET-1 , TNF-alpha , IL-1 , IL-6 , ICAM-1 , VCAM-1 , nitrate nitrite ) plasma condense exhaled air.Peripheral sensitivity hypoxia . Urinary excretion catecholamine .
DOC.criteria: Sleep apneahypopnea syndrome ( AHI > 5 ) Excessive sleepiness ( ESS > 11 ) No previous CPAP treatment Blood pressure > 180/120 mmHg . Secondary hypertension Professional driver COPD , asthma , bronchiectasis , lung cancer , restrictive lung disorder , chest wall disease Neuromuscular disease thyroid function abnormality Morbid obesity ( BMI > 40 Kg/m2 ) . Respiratory infection 2 last month . Anemia ( Hb < 10 g/dl ) polyglobulia ( Hct > 55 % ) . Diurnal hypercapnia ( PaCO2 > 45 mmHg ) moderate hypoxemia ( PaO2 < 70 mmHg ) .
